paragraphs.name: 375c
paragraphs.text: This is the third of a six-piece series that covers the best online courses for launching yourself into the data science field. We covered programming in the first article and statistics and probability in the second article. The remainder of the series will cover other data science core competencies: data visualization and machine learning.

paragraphs.text: I see you mentioned a couple of courses from the Johns Hopkins/Coursera offering, but those are only two pieces of the entire specialization. If you look at the Data Science Specialization (10 courses in all) from Johns Hopkins on Coursera (https://www.coursera.org/specializations/jhu-data-science) you’ll see it covers all of your required points…

paragraphs.name: f7fb
paragraphs.text: Important question. Those languages wouldn’t exclude courses from consideration, which is why “like” is included is this sentence: “Is the course taught using popular programming languages like Python and/or R?” Yes, they have value in a data science context. I wanted to keep it simple for audience purposes and because there aren’t many (/any?) intro…

ec56cff57e56.title: David, thanks for a great roundup.

paragraphs.name: d06a
paragraphs.text: David, thanks for a great roundup. Some noteworthy omissions in your ranking are the introductory Data Science courses in Big Data University: https://bigdatauniversity.com/learn/data-science/ … Not only do these self-paced courses provide users the opportunity to learn Data Science online for free, they also include free access to hands-on lab environment for practicing what you learn.

paragraphs.text: Machine learning is next up! Its release date will be sometime in April. There won’t be an AI-specific article for the Data Science Career Guide, though perhaps there will be for other Class Central Career Guides in the future.

c5904772b69e.title: I would add to your list a course related to social network analysis (SNA).

paragraphs.name: c52d
paragraphs.text: I would add to your list a course related to social network analysis (SNA). I know that SNA is not data science. However, SNA provides a set of powerful techniques to model connections in order to extract and visualize hidden knowledge. Summarizing, SNA is an excellent toolbox that might help you whenever you need to do some data science analysis…
